title: Avalanche-Safe Travel Timing
brief: When to travel in avalanche-prone terrain to minimize risk.
steps: Step 1: Identify hilly terrain where avalanches appear possible before planning your route.
Step 2: Plan travel through avalanche areas for early morning hours.
Step 3: Avoid avalanche-prone slopes during warmer parts of the day when snow is more unstable.
Step 4: Choose alternative routes around avalanche zones when possible.
warnings: Avalanches can be triggered by the weight and vibration of a person crossing unstable snow.
Afternoon warming makes snow more likely to slide.
Even small avalanches can be fatal by burying or carrying you over cliffs.
